intro: Bertiera spicata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser spiky bertiera, is a shrub native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used by local communities for various health purposes. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its unique foliage and floral display.
